oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. James B. Owen to his wife, Sally
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf., USA, wrote to his wife, Sarah (Sally) Bell. He fought at Thompson's Hill, Raymond, and Champion's Hill, Miss., reporting prisoners and arms taken, and noting that they left Jackson, Miss. in ashes. Owen described; the start of the siege of Vicksburg, "we level them by day with artillery and the mortar boats shell them at night," and believed the Confederates would surrender soon. He reported good health, but died Aug. 26, 1863 of yellow fever at Vicksburg.
